intro: Ouratea serrata, commonly known as the serrated ouratea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
